<<<<<<< HEAD
The pedlars case stated; or, some remarks upon the pedlars, and all their carrying of goods abroad to proffer to sale in all cities towns, and places throughout England and Wales, &c. in order to the prevention thereof.
1 sheet ([2] p.)
These papers are to be had at the Three Pidgeons in Cornhil, London, over against the Exchange, [London] : [1691?]
Date of publication from Wing. Copy stained and creased. Reproduction of the original in the Lincoln's Inn Library, London.
=======
